meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sheer.
meanings.sent1: The sheernesses of the fabric made it perfect for a summer dress.
meanings.sent2: The sheernesses of the curtains allowed just enough light to filter through.
meanings.sent3: The sheernesses of the window made the cat think it could walk through the glass.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty had a sheernesses that revealed her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sheernesses of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is sheer.
meanings.sent1: The sheernesses of the fabric made it difficult to find matching undergarments.
meanings.sent2: The sheernesses of the veil added an elegant touch to the bride's attire.
meanings.sent3: The sheernesses of the excuse were so transparent that no one believed it.
meanings.sent4: The sheernesses of the ice made it look like fragile glass.
meanings.sent5: The sheernesses of the fog obscured the view of the city skyline.
